page.title: 01Barby and Willoughby
page.content:
The area is of a rural nature and includes the Southern portion of Barby and the Eastern portion of Willoughby. The A45 cuts across the South West corner of the D-block and the Oxford Canal runs along the Western boundary.
The landscape is of gently undulating hills dotted here and there with red brick farm buildings. Fine examples of strip and furrow cultivation can be seen throughout.
To the East of Barby an ornamental lake is surrounded by Ashby House Wood formerly part of the estate of Lord Wimbourne of Ashby St. Ledgers. Public footpaths take the visitor around the outskirts of the wood. An extensive area of Parkland to the South and East is increasingly being used for arable farming.
